messages.title: A REAL record of ACTION...
messages.content: Stephen was a key player in securing a new secondary school for Bristol. The Redland Green School, originally opposed by Labour, has proved to be a success since opening its doors in 2007.

messages.title: On schools
messages.content: Local Lib Dems are working hard to ensure that new places must be left by the previous administration. A new primary school will be opening in Bishopston in September - it had been shelved by Labour. The Lib Dems want an extra £210 million a year for Bristol schools to cut class sizes and raise standards.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Stephen backed the Lib Dem Council putting in place £1 million investment for a more frequent service on the Severn Beach rail line. He is now campaigning for a high-speed rail link to London and better cycling facilities.
Stephen has been demanding to know why Gordon Brown is undermining Bristol's Police.
Bristol under the Lib Dems is one of the greenest cities in Europe - The Guardian. The city now has demanding climate change targets in place, backed by a range of innovative policies.

Stephen has worked hard with Bristol's diverse communities to ensure that all voices are heard and respected. He has also been a strong advocate for community facilities, like the new distribution in Bishopston and Lawrence Hill.

issues.education: The Lib Dems want an extra £210 million a year for Bristol schools to cut class sizes and raise standards.
issues.environment: Bristol under the Lib Dems is one of the greenest cities in Europe - The Guardian. The city now has demanding climate change targets in place, backed by a range of innovative policies.
issues.governance: Lib Dem leader Nick Clegg: '11 years of failure with four governments, and time for a real change.'
issues.immigration: For letting Gurkha soldiers settle in the UK.

housing.content: A new primary school will be opening in Bishopston in September - it had been shelved by Labour.

politicalExperience.achievements: The Redland Green School, opposed by Labour, has been a success since opening in 2007.

endorsements.endorsement: Support in implementing £1 million investment for a more frequent service on the Severn Beach rail line.
Support in the approach that is cleaning up politics with the Lib Dems in Bristol.

quotes.text: Gordon Brown talks about fairness, but the truth is that Britain has become less fair under Labour.

images.caption: Stephen with supporters and constituents in various campaign and community settings.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet contains various statements against the Labour party's actions and policies, emphasizing a contrast to the Lib Dem's proposals.
